name: Posix.IO

aliases.name: Process
aliases.type: { argv : List.List String.String, pid : Basics.Int, env : Dict.Dict String.String String.String }

values.name: andThen
values.comment:
Compose IO actions, `andThen` style

    File.open "file.txt"
        |> exitOnError identity
        |> andThen
            (\fd ->
                File.write fd "Hello, World"
            )
values.type: (a -> Posix.IO.IO b) -> Posix.IO.IO a -> Posix.IO.IO b

values.name: do
values.comment:
Compose IO actions, do-notation style.

    do (File.open "file.txt" |> exitOnError identity) <| \fd ->
    do (File.write fd "Hello, World")
values.type: Posix.IO.IO a -> (a -> Posix.IO.IO b) -> Posix.IO.IO b

values.name: exitOnError
values.comment: Print to stderr and exit program on `Err`
values.type: (error -> String.String) -> Posix.IO.IO (Result.Result error a) -> Posix.IO.IO a

values.name: program
values.comment:
module HelloUser exposing (program)

    import Dict exposing (Dict)
    import Posix.IO as IO exposing (IO, Process)
    import Posix.IO.File as File

    helloUser : Process -> IO ()
    helloUser process =
        let
            userName =
                Dict.get "USER" process.env
                    |> Maybe.withDefault "Unknown"
        in
        File.write File.stdOut userName

    program : IO.PosixProgram
    program =
        IO.program helloUser

name: Posix.IO.File
